author: Special Correspondent
text:
Members of the Salem Bar Association staging demonstration in Salem on Thursday demanding strengthening of security arrangements on the court premises.—Photo: E. Lakshmi Narayanan

Advocates attached to the Salem Bar Association boycotted the court for a day on Thursday demanding stepping up security arrangements on the district court campus here.

A group of anti-social elements made attempt on the life of a murder case accused by hurling country bombs at him and chasing him with deadly weapons on the court campus on Monday.

An advocate Murugan Carr suffered injuries in the incident.

To condemn the incident and demanding adequate compensation to Mr. Murugan, the members Salem Bar Association boycotted the courts and also staged a demonstration in front of the court premises. President of the Bar Association G. Ponnusamy led the agitation. He said that police should take effective steps to prevent the recurrence of such incidents which were of serious nature.
title: Lawyers boycott court
